question: A charged particle is subjected to acceleration in a cyclotron as shown. The charged particle undergoes increase in its speed
images/2023-phy-56-1.png
choices: Only in the gap between <katex>$D_{1}$</katex> and <katex>$D_{2}$</katex>
explanation: Acceleration (increase in speed) happens due to the electric field, which exists only in the gap between the Dees. Inside the Dees, field is zero (shielding) and particle moves in constant speed circular path.
